result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa A Carabajal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 1 day sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Continue with all mental health treatment/medications deemed appropriate.

No violent contact with the victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Case 15CM1865 is dismissed and read in.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa A Carabajal

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt:
Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by
Attorney Voss.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Melissa A Carabajal in court with attorney Thomas K. Voss.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
40 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
1 Day Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 12 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No Violent contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Continue with all Mental Heath treatment/medications deemed appropriate.

Costs:  $243
DV Surcharge:  $100
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 9, 2015 at 09:45 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Melissa A Carabajal in court with attorney Thomas K. Voss.   

State's offer is predicated on treatment.
Defendant is currently engaged in treatment.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 09:45 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Melissa A Carabajal in court with attorney Thomas K. Voss.   
Defense still waiting on discovery.
Defense did receive the pretrial offer in court.
File not called on the record.
  Hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 06/04/15.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Treatment Letter, received and filed in court by the defendant.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Melissa A Carabajal in court.  

Defendant went to the Public Defender's Office and doesn't qualify for representation.
Defendant requests the Court appoint counsel.

Court grants - Appointment of Counsel.
Court to appoint counsel.
Defendant to pay at the rate of $50 per month, starting 07/01/15 and the 1st of every month.

  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant is not to have any violent contact with family members. Defendnat to contact assessment facility or Waukesha County Human Services to set up an AODA assessment within the next 30 days.

Defendant Melissa A Carabajal in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.
